definition: to lean over/to bend over/to stoop/to bow
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: They ducked down behind a wall as stones began to fly.
sentences.chinese: 他们在石块飞过来时急忙俯身蹲到一堵墙后。

sentences.english: He leaned forward and took two vials from the drawer, a blue one and a pink one.
sentences.chinese: 医生俯身向前，从抽屉里取出一蓝一粉两只小瓶。

sentences.english: Dressed in green in the trees leaned over the touch.
sentences.chinese: 俯身触摸身穿绿衣的小树。

sentences.english: Bend forward slightly at the hip, keeping your back straight, until you feel a slight stretch in your hamstrings.
sentences.chinese: 保持背部平直慢慢俯身，直到感觉腿筋拉紧。

sentences.english: Harry moved toward Neville, who was bending over another body.
sentences.chinese: 哈利朝俯身查看另一具尸体的纳威走去。

sentences.english: She stooped down to pick a flower.
My sweater started to singe when I leaned over a burning candle.
sentences.chinese: 我俯身靠向燃着的蜡烛时把毛衣烧焦了。

sentences.english: He reached down and kissed my face.
sentences.chinese: 他俯身过来亲吻我的脸。

sentences.english: Emma bent over the little sucking mite.
sentences.chinese: 埃玛俯身给小东西喂奶。

sentences.english: If they are leaningforward, you should be doing the same.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们俯身前倾，你也要同样做。

sentences.english: Then the bear leaned over the edge of the hot spring and grasped the phone.
sentences.chinese: 然后熊俯身越过温泉边沿，抓住手机。

sentences.english: The male student wasleaning over to look at the female student’s paper.
sentences.chinese: 照片里的男学生俯身偷瞄女学生的试卷。

sentences.english: Muslims bow to Mecca when they pray.
sentences.chinese: 穆斯林祈祷时向麦加圣地俯身跪拜。

sentences.english: Get down to the level of the flowers before taking the picture.
sentences.chinese: 拍花之前要俯身到与花一样的高度。

sentences.english: The peasants leaned down to reap wheat.
The summer dream Ze Fu body kisses the lip of Yi snow.
sentences.chinese: 夏梦泽俯身吻住伊雪的唇。

definition: to lean forward/to lean out (of a window, door etc)
to bow/to bend at the waist
to reach out with one's hand/to hold out a hand/(fig.) to beg/to get involved/to meddle
to get up/to leave/to set forth
to hold in one's arms/to embrace
to get up on hind legs (esp. of horse)/to stand/to spring up
